newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish new car registrations up 8 pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Swedish new car registrations up 8 pct in 1996.

text.p: New car registrations in Sweden rose eight percent to 183,820 in 1996, the Association of Swedish Automobile Manufacturerers and Wholesalers, AB Bilstatistik, said on Friday.
The figures were AB Bilstatistik's definitive ones for the year, it said.
In December the number of new car registrations rose 17 percent to 17,593 cars, the organisation said.
For 1996, the Volvo 800 S/V/C70 contributed 22,679 to the total compared to 24,514 a year earlier, followed by the Volvo 900 S/V90, which accounted for 13,301 compared to 19,351 in 1995.

Next was the VW Golf, of which new car registrations rose to 9,231 from 7,906 followed by the Ford Escort, at 8,078 compared to 7,458. Registrations of the Saab 900 fell to 7,915 from 8,886 in 1995 while those of the Saab 9000 fell to 7,733 from 9,537.
Registrations of the Volvo S40/V40 rose to 6,756 from 27 and of the Ford Mondeo new registrations rose to 6,210 from 5,466.
Next was the Opel Astra at 5,826 compared to 6,500 and the Audi 80/A4 at 5,717 compared to 4,280.
